name: wiki-go
description: wiki-go is a lightweight self-hosted wiki engine written in Go. It focuses on simplicity, markdown-based pages, fast performance, and easy deployment, making it suitable for small documentation sites and personal knowledge bases.
features: Markdown editing: Write and edit wiki pages using markdown syntax for simple formatting.
Fast performance: Benefit from Go's efficiency with quick page loads and minimal resource usage.
File-based storage: Store wiki content as plain text files for easy backup and version control.
Search functionality: Find content quickly with full-text search across all wiki pages.
Page linking: Create internal links between pages to build an interconnected knowledge base.
Version history: Track page changes over time with built-in revision history and diff viewing.
Syntax highlighting: Display code blocks with proper syntax highlighting for technical documentation.
Attachment support: Upload and embed images or files within wiki pages.
User authentication: Protect your wiki with password authentication and user management.
Responsive design: Access and edit wiki pages from any device with a mobile-friendly interface.
Export options: Export pages or entire wikis to HTML or PDF for offline distribution.
Minimal dependencies: Deploy easily with a single binary and no external database requirements.
